intro: Leuconotis griffithii var. sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran star orchid, is a species of orchid native to the island of Sumatra. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and reducing water loss. This orchid thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests.
